com.namics.oss.spring.support.i18n.excel

Class ExcelReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.namics.oss.spring.support.i18n.excel.ExcelReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Excel

    @Component(value="defaultExcelReader")
public class ExcelReader
extends Object
implements Excel
    Util class that uses apache poi library to parse an excel resource file in namics format. The excel sheet may contain several sheets. Each sheet of the file must have the default form:
    • Line 1 (Header): KEY | de | fr | more iso-language-codes ...
    • Line 2..n (Values): message.key | Deutsch | Francaise | other translation

    The header columns define the language used for the resulting resource bundle.
    Important for treatment:

    • Header row is mandatory and defining, no empty cells in between languages are allowed
    • Column header for languages must be valid lowercase two-letter ISO-639 codes.
    • Empty rows in the content pane are ignored
    • keys without translations are ignored
    • Rows with empty KEY cell in the content body are ignored
    • Empty translation cells in the content body are ignored
    • Content cells in a column without header are ignored
    The concrete row and column numbers can be configured to match more requirements like comments.
    Since:
    Namics commons i18n 1.0 - Oct 13, 2010
    Author:
    aschaefer, namics ag

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExcelReader

        public ExcelReader()
        Constructor to create reader for default excel layout.

      • ExcelReader

        public ExcelReader(int languageHeaderRow,
                   int keyColumn,
                   int firstLanguageColumn)
        Constructor to create a reader for a customized excel. You can use the DEFAULT_* constants to set defaults for certain values.
        Parameters:
        languageHeaderRow - defines the row number in the sheet that defines the header (default:0, first row).
        keyColumn - defines the column that is used for the message code (default:0, the first column).
        firstLanguageColumn - defines the first column used for languages (default:1, second column).

    • Method Detail

      • processExcel

        public List<MessageResourceEntry> processExcel(File file)
                                        throws I18nException
        Method processes a provided Excel file and reads the messages in it. Therefore all sheets in the Excel file are read and processed. Each sheet of the file must have the form:
        • Line 1 (Header): KEY | de | fr | more iso-language-codes ...
        • Line 2..n (Values): message.key | Deutsch | Francaise | other translation

        The header columns define the language used for the resulting resource bundle.
        Important for treatment:

        • Header row is mandatory and defining, no empty cells in between languages are allowed
        • Column header for languages must be valid lowercase two-letter ISO-639 codes.
        • Empty rows in the content pane are ignored
        • keys without translations are ignored
        • Rows with empty KEY cell in the content body are ignored
        • Empty translation cells in the content body are ignored
        • Content cells in a column without header are ignored
        Format may be alteret using configuration parameters of this class.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to read, must be a valid Excel file (xls, xlsx)
        Returns:
        a List of all property entries
        Throws:
        I18nException - when something failed during Reading of the file

      • processExcel

        public List<MessageResourceEntry> processExcel(InputStream input)
                                        throws I18nException
        Method processes a provided Excel file input stream and reads the messages in it. Therefore all sheets in the Excel file are read and processed. Each sheet of the file must have the form:
        • Line 1 (Header): KEY | de | fr | more iso-language-codes ...
        • Line 2..n (Values): message.key | Deutsch | Francaise | other translation

        The header columns define the language used for the resulting resource bundle.
        Important for treatment:

        • Header row is mandatory and defining, no empty cells in between languages are allowed
        • Column header for languages must be valid lowercase two-letter ISO-639 codes.
        • Empty rows in the content pane are ignored
        • keys without translations are ignored
        • Rows with empty KEY cell in the content body are ignored
        • Empty translation cells in the content body are ignored
        • Content cells in a column without header are ignored
        Format may be altered using configuration parameters of this class.
        Parameters:
        input - the input stream of the file to read, must be a valid Excel file (xls, xlsx)
        Returns:
        a List of all property entries
        Throws:
        I18nException - when something failed during Reading of the file
